snippet: Jubilant gay rights advocates called the results a historic turning point, a sign that public opinion is shifting in their direction.
abstract: Voters in Maine and Maryland approve same-sex marriage rights on election night that jubilant gay rights advocates call historic turning point; it marks first time that marriage for gay men and lesbians has been approved at the ballot box.

byline.contributor: Isolde Raftery contributed reporting from Seattle, and Emmarie Huetteman from Baltimore.

lead_paragraph: Jubilant gay rights advocates called the results a historic turning point, a sign that public opinion is shifting in their direction.

headline.seo: Maine and Maryland Voters Approve Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: In Maine and Maryland, Victories at the Ballot Box for Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: In Maine and Maryland, Victories at the Ballot Box for Same-Sex Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
